result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Paul Bovee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Schedule II Narcotic, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: 3:08 pm case called. Defendant Jason Paul Bovee in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement reached and stated on record-defense free to argue.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses outright the repeater enhancer. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Attorney Wallace. Statement by Defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 2 years. Consecutive to any other sentence.  CONDITIONS: AODA and follow through, Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Costs to include the DNA surcharge and $100 Drug Buy money, be paid within 60 days or payment plan. Appeal Rights Given.

1:45 pm case called. Defendant Jason Paul Bovee in court with attorney John H. Wallace.  Steven P. Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing and time limits discussed.  Defendant wishes to waive the right to have a preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant regarding waiver of right to preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of right to a preliminary hearing. Court has read the criminal complaint, finds probable cause and enters an order over for trial. Information filed. Attorney Wallace confirms receipt and waives further reading. Entry of NGP. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State. Court cancels warrant based on appearance of the defendant.  Status conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 02:05 pm.
